newsitem.title: USA: Hurco sees Q3 gain on patent settlement.
newsitem.headline: Hurco sees Q3 gain on patent settlement.

text.p: Hurco Cos Inc said it expects to recognize additional net income of about $500,000 in its third fiscal quarter ending July 31 on the settlement of a patent case.
Hurco said its IMS Technology Inc unit agreed to a settlement of its patent infringement claims against Southwestern Industries Inc, a maker of computer numerical control systems.
Under the settlement, IMS will license its interactive CNC technology patent to Southwestern in exchange for a one-time cash payment of $800,000 to IMS, Hurco said.
Hurco said the IMS patent is the subject of pending infringement actions brought by IMS against several manufacturers and end-users of computer numerical control systems, including Southwestern.
IMS' infringement actions are not affected by the Southwestern settlement, said Hurco, a producer of computer numerical control systems for stand-alone machine tools.
